turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Could you please donate all of your$2 to Save the Children?  Hunger kills millions of children worldwide ever year.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: No thank you, I understand that hunger kills millions of children world wide every year, however the CEO's of that company are multi billionaire entrepreneurs.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Save the Children has been around since 1919 qng is top rated by Charity Watch.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: How much of the Save the Children money, go to children in the United States?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: In fiscal year 2016, on average, 86.5% of all expenditures support program services. 86.5% is an average for all of Save the Children's programs worldwide.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I don't agree with the fact that they give so much to Britians poor families, when poor families in America could use money through this charity

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: What makes American children more needy?  To be honest, not having a cell phone is hardly poverty. American children are hardly in the situation that many African children are

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I feel that if America is going to be at the forefront of a charity...it should be helping our own...for instance, our veterans are highly under benefited and paid!!!!  Why not give to them!!!  Maybe Africa's government should do something about their needy children since this charity expects the U.S. to do something about theirs!!

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Why not be charitable to all?  $2 is hardly a sum to argue about.  17 cents can feed  child overseas.  12 kids could be fed today with that money.  Hope didn't go to Starbucks today and get a $4 coffee.  Now that's a corporate contribution.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: No I don't spend my money at Starbucks because they don't support gun rights...  For being an ambassador for this charity you are sure quick into bullying someone to give to this charity!!!

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I'm not being a bully. Ok, if $2 is too much, how about $1?  I'm with you on gun rights BTW.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I tell you what I will feed one over sees child at .12, I take these task roles, to make money not give it away...if I wasn't living paycheck to paycheck I would not be doing them.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I'm in the same boat.  I need the money too.  But it wouldn't hurt to give a little.  MTurk doesn't exactly pay subsistence wages.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Your right, but every little bit helps!  When you have two children and have a husband that works his butt off, and you are a college student...you have to do something to fill in the gaps

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I'm a retiree. Let's say Social Security isn't a treasure trove either.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I know the boat your in too, I have grandparents that can barely make ends meet.  With what they bring in, in social security payments.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Despite all, I will donating a dollar.  I hope you do too.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I will donate .12 and I wish my grandparents would learn how to be technical on a computer, so they could earn some money to supplement their income...like you.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Thanks.  I appreciate it.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: your welcome. better luck with your next partner.
